publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

msIdentifier.repository: Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

seg.seg: ... he will obtain the fruit of the lakṣaṇas.
… he will obtain the fruit of the lakṣaṇas. (Georges-Jean Pinault, p.c.; cf 280)
Thus having understood it for truth he will obtain fame in the world.
Thus having understood it for truth he will obtain fame in the world. (Georges-Jean Pinault, p.c.; cf 280)

list.item: a1 (ko)_ī |(snai) stemi silñesa|silläññesā || a(r)wan(e) || #M12# kā lm(au) tāk· ·tu ; e(kä)tk(ātte) , – ·r· – #1a – – a – ·l· ; – – ·sk· – , – – a2 – #1b (piś cmelaṣṣeṃts|cme)l(aṣṣ)e(ntsä ; s)am(u)d(t)ärntse , totteññe #1c ekätkātte se ; mā srukalñe , yänmālle 1 #1d || walo weṣṣäṃ • tā|ta k_uce cakravārttiññe|cakkravārt(t)i(ññe) /// a3 /// (samu)dtärntse totteññe yänmāskeṃ • asite weṣṣäṃ • tā|ta k_uce cakravārttiññe tane|täne pakutär|päk_utär a4 /// (śaiṣṣe)ne wätkāltsäññe • brāhmaṇe|brahmaṇe weṣṣäṃ • nauṣaññeṃ|nauṣäññeṃ rṣākeṃts poñ|poñä śastarma|śastä|(rnma) a5 /// #M12# päklyauṣso|(pklyauṣä)s śastarma|śastärnmā ; allaiknesa|alaiknesa , mäskentär|mäskenträ • #1a lakṣānäntants|lakṣanäntantsä ; epiṅkte|epiṅt(e) – – a6 – – – #1b – – – – – ; – cakravārttintants|(cakkra)vārt(t)in(t)ānt(sä) • #1c täryāka wi|(w)ī ; lakṣānänta|lakṣāṇänta , te-yäknesak|taik(n)esākä • #1d ·e – /// b1 /// – n· yänm(ā)sk(eṃ) • p(ā)lk(a) twe|tuw(e) || pr(a)ś(a)ntahā(r)n(e) || #M12# taka|täka ran(o) – ; b2 – – – – – – #1a – – – – ; – – – – , astarya|(a)stäryā #1b pällentäṣṣepi ; läkutsauñaiśc|läk_utsewñaiśc , meñantse|meñäntse #1c mäk(t)ān tāsau tā ; – b3 – – – – – #1d – – lakṣānäntants|(la)kṣānäntāntsä oko yanmaṃ|yänmaṃ • asite weṣṣäṃ • päklyauṣ|päklyauṣä || pañcamne|pañcämne || #M14# – b4 – – – – – – ; po ostameṃ|ostämeṃ , ltuweṣ_(Pl.)|ltuweṣä #1a manta|mantā kca|kcā nauṣ , śärsāre ; spelkkessoñc|spelkessoñc ra|rā , nesamane|nesmāne #1b cai – b5 – – , – – – ; – – – – , |(snai) lyipär|lyīprä #1c kärsau te mant|mänt , empreṃtsa|empreṃtsā ; kallaṃ|källaṃ klāwi , śaiṣṣene 1 #1d || poñc ākteke mäskentär|mä(ske)|ntär b6 (wa)lo w(e)ṣṣäṃ • ñem-klawissu|ñem-klāw(i)ssu • orocce wakitsäñ(ñ)ene stmoṣ|stmoṣä weñāsta|wñāsta twe|tuwe • pañäktäññe|päñäktäñ(ñ)e (klāw)i

I have entered a very preliminary transliteration based on the transcription and the photograph in order to test the XML conversion scripts. It should be revised while marking up the akṣaras in Transkribus. (BK)

Alternative classifications:
Peyrotarchaic I
Malzahncommon archaic
Tamai–
Tamai-C14–

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a3 … he will obtain the fruit of the lakṣaṇas. (Georges-Jean Pinault, p.c.; cf [[Couvreur 1953]]: 280) 673
a5 Thus having understood it for truth he will obtain fame in the world. (Georges-Jean Pinault, p.c.; cf [[Couvreur 1953]]: 280) 300


please do not cite without asking Michaël Peyrot or Georges-Jean Pinault

  • "<sup>1a</sup>" etc. changed to "#1a" etc., "¦" changed to ";". –Martin (Wed, 2014-10-15, 16:34:48)
  • What does b3 "~" mean!? –Martin (Wed, 2014-10-15, 16:34:48)
    • "~" replaced by "•". Presumably "~" stands for a stretched-out "•"? - BK, TI
  • First line "(tā)" removed due to violations of several notation rules. –Martin (Wed, 2014-10-15, 16:41:04)

additional classification A1
a3 ... he will obtain the fruit of the lakṣaṇas. a5 Thus having understood it for truth he will obtain fame in the world.

div.p:
I have entered a very preliminary transliteration based on the transcription and the photograph in order to test the XML conversion scripts. It should be revised while marking up the akṣaras in Transkribus. (BK)

Alternative classifications:

please do not cite without asking Michaël Peyrot or Georges-Jean Pinault

  • "<sup>1a</sup>" etc. changed to "#1a" etc., "¦" changed to ";". –Martin (Wed, 2014-10-15, 16:34:48)
  • What does b3 "~" mean!? –Martin (Wed, 2014-10-15, 16:34:48)
    • "~" replaced by "•". Presumably "~" stands for a stretched-out "•"? - BK, TI
  • First line "(tā)" removed due to violations of several notation rules. –Martin (Wed, 2014-10-15, 16:41:04)

additional classification A1
